articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine is ready to sign a mineral resources deal with the United States and could do so later on Wednesday, a Ukrainian government source told Reuters.
articles.title: Kyiv ready to sign resources deal with US, Ukraine government source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said it carried out a strike in Syria against extremists who attacked members of the Druze community, following through on a promise to protect the minority group as sectarian violence spread near Damascus on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel says it hit extremists in Syria to protect Druze

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Columbia University student Mohsen Mahdawi was released from U.S. immigration custody on Wednesday, after a judge ruled he should be free on bail to challenge the Trump administration's efforts to deport him over his participation in pro-Palestinian protests.
articles.title: Palestinian student released on bail as he challenges deportation from US

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description: A narrowly divided U.S. Senate rejected the latest bipartisan bid to block President Donald Trump's tariffs on Wednesday, just hours after the federal government reported that the nation's economy contracted for the first time in three years amid the chaos of the president's tariff policies.
articles.title: US Senate rejects bill to rein in Trump tariffs as economy contracts

articles.author: Shivam Patel, Tanvi Mehta
articles.description: India's foreign minister said he has told Secretary of State Marco Rubio that perpetrators of the deadly attack in Kashmir last week should be brought to justice, as the U.S. sought to calm tensions between nuclear-armed India and Pakistan.
articles.title: India wants Kashmir attackers brought to justice, foreign minister tells Rubio

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Australia's centre-left Labor government is likely to retain power in a close-run national election this weekend, two opinion polls showed on Thursday, with voters ranking U.S. President Donald Trump's policies among their top concerns.
articles.title: Australia's centre-left Labor likely to retain power as Trump concerns weigh, polls show

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said the construction of a new bridge linking it to Russia is a "significant" development of relations between the two countries, state media KCNA reported on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea says new bridge to Russia reinforces economic cooperation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's Supreme Court will issue a ruling on Thursday in a case involving presidential frontrunner Lee Jae-myung, which could disqualify the former opposition party leader from contesting the country's June 3 election.
articles.title: South Korea's top court to rule on presidential frontrunner's case as election looms

articles.author: Nelson Acosta
articles.description: Cuba is pinning its hopes on attracting more visitors from Communist ally China as part of a last-ditch bid to revive a sputtering tourism industry devastated by renewed U.S. sanctions under the Trump administration and a crisis-wracked economy.
articles.title: Cuba pins hopes on China to help save sputtering tourism industry

articles.author: Judith Langowski
articles.description: Former U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris called on Wednesday for Americans to stand up together against U.S. President Donald Trump and what she called "the greatest man-made economic crisis in modern presidential history".
articles.title: Harris returns to national stage praising Trump opponents' courage
